subject: Looking for good presentations of Unit Testing/TDD

messageBody:
I've introduced Scrum to several projects at my company (with two more
in the way). While the groups that are practicing Scrum are fairly
advanced and use unit testing (some even do TDD), there is still a
broad community within our organisation that has never even considered
Unit Testing/TDD (some even at the bottom of services stack).

I'm going to organize a series of lunch and learn sessions to workshop
J.B.'s book and help make unit testing part of the everyday culture.
To kick this off I need a kick ass presentation that will demonstrate
the value of TDD and Unit testing. The goal of the presentation: sell
people on TDD and motivate people to spend 10-12 weeks workshopping
the book at lunch. I was wondering is anyone aware of any
presentations that would make a good starting point? Or will I have to
write my own scratch?

My rough plan
- Discuss the benefits of Unit testing
- Work through a body of existing code, writing tests and
refactoring as we go - demonstrating how unit tests can force us to
simplify our code.

In addition any pointers on how people organise sessions like this
would also help - however I will try to make this as participant
driven as possible.

What are your favorite presentations? How have you organized lunch and
learn sessions?

BTW I have googled on the subject and haven't found anything of great
quality. Before I sink several days of effort I thought I would ask you.

Thanks
Mark Levison
http://www.notesfromatooluser.com/
